translation.en: [woman 1 in Spanish] I'm always dreaming of Puerto Rico.
I have dreamed of the town I lived in with my friends.
[woman 2 in Spanish] In Puerto Rico, I have happiness. I have stability.
[woman 3 in Spanish] Life in Puerto Rico was beautiful, but also difficult.
translation.ko: 푸에르토리코에서 사는 건 멋지고도 어려운 일이었죠

translation.en: But let me tell you, the food, the people...
One day, I'll go back to my island.
[woman 3] She stormed in like a monster,
completely devastating Puerto Rico.
-[in Spanish] Is it open? -[woman] Yes, the door is open.
translation.ko: - 문이 열려 있나요? - 응, 문은 열려 있어

translation.en: [Nilda] After the hurricane passed, everything was destroyed.
translation.ko: 허리케인이 지나간 후에 모든 게 망가졌어요

translation.en: It didn't look like the same island.
[woman 3] The first thing that failed was the communications system.
translation.ko: 제일 먼저 망가진 것이 통신 시스템이었어요

translation.en: There was no cell reception, no ATMs, no bank system.
translation.ko: 휴대폰 수신이 안 됐고 현금 지급기도, 은행도 망가졌죠

translation.en: It didn't matter if you had money or not.
The government said, "Prepare yourselves for two weeks."
translation.ko: 정부에선 이렇게 말했어요 '2주는 있어야 될 겁니다'

translation.en: Everyone prepared. Most of the people did. I did too.
translation.ko: "케니아" 모든 사람들이 기다렸어요 대부분이 그랬죠, 저도 그랬고

translation.en: But I never thought that, even two weeks in, it'd still be chaos.
translation.ko: 하지만 2주 후에도 여전히 혼돈 상태일 줄은 꿈에도 몰랐어요

translation.en: [woman 2] I had never seen Puerto Rico like that.
translation.ko: 푸에르토리코가 그렇게 된 건 처음 봤어요

translation.en: You'd go out on the streets,
and you would see all the trees without any leaves,
destroyed houses, people crying and yelling outside.
translation.ko: 집은 부서졌고 사람들이 밖에서 울고 소리쳤죠

translation.en: By 5:00 or 6:00 p.m., night would come,
and it was very dark. Too dark.
So we gathered and slept in one room together, all of us,
translation.ko: 그래서 우린 한방에 모여 잤죠 안전을 위해서, 전부 다 같이요

translation.en: to be safe.
[Glenda] Half of my house was exposed.
And then the rats and the snakes started to turn up,
translation.ko: 쥐와 뱀 같은 것들이 우글거리기 시작했죠

translation.en: like they were fighting over who would be the last one to survive.
translation.ko: 마치 마지막으로 살아남기 위해 싸우는 것처럼요

translation.en: FEMA arrived at my house two months later.
translation.ko: 2달 후, 연방재난관리청 사람들이 우리 집에 왔어요

translation.en: They told me, "You cannot live here."
[Nilda] I didn't want to leave.
I had my dog, Chico.
I had my best friend.
[Kenia] Easy.
[Nilda] But I had no choice. Things had to get better.
translation.ko: 어쩔 수가 없었어요 상황이 더 나아지려면요

translation.en: But I was prepared to come here.
translation.ko: 하지만 저는 여기로 돌아오겠다고 마음먹고 있었죠

translation.en: [reporter in English] Ten and a half months since Hurricane Maria
translation.ko: "브롱크스에 오신 걸 환영합니다" 허리케인 마리아가 푸에르토리코를 파괴한 지 10개월 반이 지났습니다

translation.en: devastated Puerto Rico,
translation.ko: 허리케인 마리아가 푸에르토리코를 파괴한 지 10개월 반이 지났습니다

translation.en: nearly half the island still does not have electricity.
translation.ko: 섬의 거의 절반이 아직도 전기가 들어오지 않습니다

translation.en: [reporter 2] The slow pace of recovery has lead hundreds of thousands of Puerto Ricans,
who are American citizens, to relocate on the U.S. mainland.
translation.ko: 수십 만의 푸에르토리코인이 미국 본토로 이주했죠 "뉴욕, 올랜도, 비스마크"

translation.en: [reporter 3] Transitional shelter assistance
provides hotel rooms for displaced Puerto Ricans to live in.
translation.ko: 푸에르토리코 이재민들에게 호텔 방을 제공하고 있습니다

translation.en: And they've got until June 30th
before FEMA will finally discontinue the program.
translation.ko: 연방재난관리청은 이 조치를 연장하지 않을 것입니다

translation.en: So they essentially will be homeless at the end of June.
translation.ko: 그래서 6월 말이 되면 이재민들은 거리에 나앉게 되죠

translation.en: [Glenda in Spanish] Pretty! Look!
translation.ko: "하지만 허리케인 마리아 피해자는 같은 혜택을 받지 못했다"

translation.en: And you haven't come to see me. That's why I didn't show you.
translation.ko: 날 안 찾아왔잖아요 그래서 안 보여준 거예요

translation.en: Look at this one. You like the big ones. Look how cute this one is!
translation.ko: 이거 봐요, 큰 거 좋아하잖아요 이게 얼마나 귀여운지 봐요!

translation.en: -And you haven't come to see me. -But I don't...
-I don't like silver. -This isn't silver. It's gold, sweetheart.
translation.ko: - 은이 싫어요 - 이거 은이 아니라 금이에요

translation.en: Oh, are they bigger than these? The bigger, the better.
translation.ko: 오, 이거보다 더 큰데요? 크면 클수록 좋죠

translation.en: Honey, these are the biggest ones there are.
If they are bigger than these, I'll buy them.
Where are you? At the park over there?
Yeah.
Are there more people there I can sell to? I will sell these to everyone.
translation.ko: 거기 이거 살 만한 사람들 있어요? 그쪽에서도 팔고 싶은데

translation.en: [Glenda] Oh, I've got this bracelet that matches your eyes!
translation.ko: 이 팔찌도 당신 눈하고 잘 어울릴 거예요!

translation.en: [Glenda] Six months, here in this hotel.
...for school tomorrow.
My husband and I share a room.
Between four walls...
all I could do was look out at the road.
But, little by little, I began to leave the room.
-[people cheering, clapping] -[all] Surprise!
-Come give me a hug. -You're going to spray me!
Is there a stripper?
Is there a stripper?
Give me a hug and a kiss.
[Glenda] I met her here at the hotel.
They are like family to me.
[Glenda] I am the crazy one in this friendship.
Kenia is very spontaneous. She always does something that makes you laugh.
translation.ko: 케니아는 아주 즉흥적이죠 항상 웃음을 줘요

translation.en: Sheila is a bit more serious. She's like our anchor.
translation.ko: 실라는 좀 더 진지하죠 우리의 정신적 지주예요

translation.en: -"Paint your hair yellow!" -[women squealing]
-Let me make a wish. -[woman 1] I wish to have an apartment.
translation.ko: 무슨 소원 빌까? - 아파트가 있으면 좋겠어 - 방 5개짜리로

translation.en: [woman 2] I wish to have a five-bedroom apartment!
I wasn't just thinking about myself.
-[woman 3] Come on, do it! -[woman 2] Five rooms for all of us.
[woman 3] The candles are moving.
-[woman 1] Move. -[woman 2] Do it!
-[woman 3] Just blow. What's with you? -[all chuckling]
-[woman 1] It's not your birthday. -I hope my wish comes true.
translation.ko: - 네 생일이 아니잖아 - 내 소원이 이뤄지면 좋겠다

translation.en: [automated voice in English] You have reached
the Federal Emergency Management Agency.
[in Spanish] For people who only speak Spanish, say, "Spanish."
-Spanish. -[voice continues indistinctly, stops]
[woman in Spanish] Good afternoon. How can I assist you?
[Kenia] I want to verify when our hotel voucher is expiring, love.
translation.ko: 저희 호텔 바우처가 언제 만료되는지 알고 싶어요

translation.en: Do we stay until June 30th and leave July 1st?
[woman] Allow me to verify so I can give you the right information.
translation.ko: 제가 확인해 보고 정확한 정보를 알려드려도 될까요?

translation.en: -No problem. Don't worry, I'll hold. -Thank you.
I've always been nice to them because...
translation.ko: 난 항상 이 사람들에게 친절하게 한단다, 왜냐하면...

translation.en: what's the point of taking it out on them?
translation.ko: 이 사람들에게 화풀이할 필요가 뭐 있겠어?

translation.en: My heart'd be like...
And they'd be like, "Sure, ma'am. No problem."
[woman] All right, ma'am. You should be leaving July 1st,
but you should verify the check-out time with the hotel.
-The 30th, I sleep here. The 1st, I leave. -That's right.
-Right. -Okay. Are there any updates?
That's the latest information. Can I help you with anything else?
translation.ko: 말씀드린 게 최신 정보예요 다른 문의 사항 있으신가요?

translation.en: No. Thank you, love. That'd be all. You're so kind.
translation.ko: 없어요, 고마워요 그게 다예요, 참 친절하네요

translation.en: Stay calm. Don't worry.
They're the ones in charge.
translation.ko: 다른 곳을 찾을 수 있을 거야

translation.en: Let's hope for a miracle.
[woman in English] The evacuee population that we work with,
we've seen an ongoing hurricane, right?
translation.ko: 지금도 허리케인 피해는 계속되고 있어요 "나타사 바난 라티노 저스티스"

translation.en: On the island, a hurricane passed. It was devastating.
translation.ko: 허리케인이 푸에르토리코를 지나가면서 엄청난 타격을 입혔죠

translation.en: There were long-term consequences.
For the evacuees, that hurricane is being renewed every month
translation.ko: 장기적인 영향을 미쳤어요 이재민들에게는 허리케인 마리아가 달마다 새롭게 느껴지죠

translation.en: because they are living under perpetually precarious situations.
They're trying to seek a job with a living wage,
translation.ko: 최저 임금을 받는 일자리라도 찾으려고 해요

translation.en: trying to get their children's needs met
and healthcare issues met.
It's an ongoing survival mode.
[in Spanish] There is an apartment for rent. We should ask.
-What? -It could be nice.
-"For rent"? -Does it say?
Over there.
[announcement over PA] Please exit at the rear door.
[Glenda] We got married on June 7th, 2017.
Four months before the hurricane.
I've had my highs and lows in love
because I've had four partners before.
I asked God to bring a good man into my life, and he showed up.
translation.ko: 좋은 남자 만나게 해달라고 기도했더니 남편이 나타났죠

translation.en: And he opened my heart to love again.
translation.ko: 그리고... 다시 사랑할 수 있도록 제 마음을 열어 줬어요

translation.en: Come here.
Ouch!
[Glenda] After Hurricane Maria,
I sat down with my husband and told him we needed to leave.
Life's not easy.
I have tumors in my throat.
The hospital system was down, there was no electricity,
translation.ko: 병원 시스템이 망가졌고 전기가 안 들어오는데다

translation.en: and many doctors had left Puerto Rico.
[Glenda] This is the one you want, right?
[woman on phone] Yes. I want a large.
Sounds good. I'll get it for you.
These are Louis Vuitton.
If you take two, I'll sell both for $25.
[Glenda] My husband works at a parking lot.
So I'm trying to make extra money to help him out.
translation.ko: 그래서 저도 돈을 좀 더 벌어서 보태려고 해요

translation.en: I try to be happy and cheerful.
How can we make it in this city when it's so difficult to live here?
translation.ko: 이 도시에서 사는 게 어려워지면 어떻게 할 거냐고요?

translation.en: [Kenia] Look, Nilda Lee,
you just have to stay calm when you're in school. Don't worry.
translation.ko: 학교에 가면 침착해야 해 걱정하지 말고

translation.en: You aren't the one misbehaving.
translation.ko: 못된 짓을 한 건 네가 아냐

translation.en: It's the other girls who are bullying you and stealing your cell phone.
translation.ko: 널 괴롭히고 휴대폰을 훔쳐간 다른 여자애들 잘못이지

translation.en: You're very mature for being 11.
I want you to look pretty and well put together.
[Nilda] This is the first time I've been bullied.
It didn't happen in Puerto Rico because I had a lot of friends there.
translation.ko: 푸에르토리코에선 그런 적 없었죠 친구가 많았거든요

translation.en: [Nilda] They don't get along with me. I don't speak English,
translation.ko: 잘해 주는 애가 없어요 전 영어를 못 하고

translation.en: and I'm from another country. I am not from their country.
translation.ko: 다른 나라에서 왔죠 같은 나라 사람이 아닌 거예요

translation.en: They bully me and tell me stuff.
[Kenia] This is our stop.
Careful.
She doesn't want to go to school.
God, it's not easy.
I miss my island. Oh, yeah.
[Kenia] We lived out in the country.
The air was natural, fresh.
It was completely quiet.
Only the sound of roosters.
I miss it.
I would bring the Puerto Rican flag with me, even to the moon.
translation.ko: 저는 달에 가도 푸에르토리코 국기를 가져갈 거예요

translation.en: [Glenda] There are so many Puerto Ricans here in the Bronx...
translation.ko: 이곳 브롱크스엔 푸에르토리코 사람들이 많이 살아요

translation.en: sometimes it feels like you're in Puerto Rico.
translation.ko: 어떨 땐 푸에르토리코에 있는 거 같죠

translation.en: [Kenia] You're walking, and the cars pass by,
and you can hear salsa music.
You go, "Oh, look at that boricua with the music blasting!"
translation.ko: 이러는 거죠, '저기 푸에르토리코 사람이 음악을 틀고 있네!'

translation.en: [Kenia] It reminds you that even though you're in a strange land,
you're still on your island.
[Glenda] Those are the shoes
-for each person that died in Puerto Rico. -Yes.
[reporter 1 in English] According to a new study,
the death toll from Hurricane Maria in Puerto Rico
translation.ko: 허리케인 마리아 때문에 푸에르토리코에서 죽은 사람이

translation.en: is more than 70 times higher than officials claim.
translation.ko: "푸에르토리코 산후안" 공식적으로 발표된 것보다 70배나 많다고 합니다

translation.en: [reporter 2] With a death toll of 4,645,
Hurricane Maria would become the second deadliest hurricane in U.S. history.
translation.ko: 미국 역사상 두 번째로 많은 사망자를 낸 허리케인이 됐습니다

translation.en: If you look at a real catastrophe like Katrina,
and you look at the tremendous hundreds and hundreds of people that died,
translation.ko: 엄청난 숫자의 사람들이 사망한 것을 봤을 때

translation.en: you can be proud of all of your people, all of our people working together.
translation.ko: 여러분과 우리가 힘을 합쳐 일한 것이 자랑스럽습니다

translation.en: [reporter 3] The governor is now highlighting the differences
of the federal government's response to other hurricanes.
translation.ko: 다른 허리케인 때와는 차이가 있다는 점을 강조하고 있습니다

translation.en: My message to all political leaders...
translation.ko: 정치 지도자 여러분들께 드리고 싶은 말씀은

translation.en: If they really, truly want to end inequality with Puerto Rico,
translation.ko: "리카르도 로세요 푸에르토리코 주지사" 푸에르토리코가 겪는 불평등을 정말로 종식시키길 원한다면

translation.en: let's not only look at what happened in the past year, past couple of years in Puerto Rico.
translation.ko: 지난 몇 년만 돌아볼 것이 아니라

translation.en: Let's look at the long-standing history.
Puerto Rico is a colonial territory.
Puerto Rican-U.S. citizens are second-class U.S. citizens.
We have the most populated colonial territory in the world,
but we don't have the right to vote.
My ask is very simple:
Do you support eliminating colonial territories
in the 21st century in the United States?
Do you support statehood for Puerto Rico?
All we're asking is to be treated equally.
translation.ko: 우리의 요구는 평등하게 대해 달라는 것뿐입니다

translation.en: [Glenda] The whole world is watching.
They don't have the courage to face us and say, "This is what happened."
translation.ko: 정부에선 '이런 상황이다'라고 대놓고 말할 용기가 없다니까

translation.en: -Trump came to throw paper towels... -Mm-hmm.
...for us to soak up our tears. You don't do that.
translation.ko: 종이 타월이나 던져주러 온 거야 그럼 안 되는데

translation.en: [Trump] I think that Puerto Rico was an incredible unsung success.
translation.ko: 푸에르토리코는 드러나진 않지만 엄청나게 성공했다고 봅니다

translation.en: It was one of the best jobs that's ever been done,
with respect to what this is all about.
translation.ko: 최고로 잘해낸 경우 중 하나라고 생각합니다

translation.en: [Kenia] My father died one month after I got here...
translation.ko: 여기 오고 나서 한 달 후에 아버지가 돌아가셨죠

translation.en: of natural causes.
But they didn't say why.
It was due to lack of light, lack of hygiene.
translation.ko: 햇빛을 못 보고 위생이 불량했기 때문이었죠

translation.en: No water, no communication.
We got here in November, and he died in December,
and I couldn't go back to see him.
But I'm not going to cry.
I need to stay strong in my heart to survive with my daughter.
translation.ko: 마음을 굳게 먹어야죠 딸과 함께 살아남으려면요

translation.en: [woman in English] How can I help you?
[in English] You speak Spanish, please?
[man in English] Hello?
[in Spanish] I'm calling to see if you have a two-bedroom apartment.
[man in Spanish] I don't have any right now,
but if you leave your name and number, I'll call you when one is available.
translation.ko: 지금은 없는데 이름과 연락처 남겨주시면 물건이 있을 때 연락드릴게요

translation.en: [recorded voice in English] Please leave a short, detailed message -so that we can get back to you. -[beeping]
translation.ko: 짧고 상세한 메시지를 남겨 주시면 다시 연락드리죠

translation.en: [automated voice] Sorry, there is no space for recording.
[Glenda in English] This is the real estate?
[man in English] Yes. Can I help you?
You speak Spanish, please?
No, I don't speak Spanish.
Okay. You have the apartment for the two room?
-[man] No, um... -What?
No. No, we don't.
[reporter 1 in English] FEMA is ending assistance for Puerto Ricans
translation.ko: 연방재난관리청은 푸에르토리코 사람들에 대한 지원을 끊고 있죠

translation.en: as many still struggle to recover after Hurricane Maria's devastating impact.
translation.ko: 허리케인 마리아의 파괴적인 영향에서 회복하는 중인데도요

translation.en: In a statement, FEMA said the program was, quote,
"A temporary solution that bridges survivors into more permanent options."
translation.ko: '영구적인 주거지를 찾을 수 있게 도와주는 임시적인 조치'라고 했죠

translation.en: Permanent options tough to find in the tight rental market.
translation.ko: 빡빡한 임대 시장에서 영구적인 주거지는 찾기 힘듭니다

translation.en: Hurricane Maria survivors have to find their own place to live
translation.ko: 허리케인 마리아의 생존자들은 살 곳을 찾아야 합니다

translation.en: or receive a one-way plane ticket back to Puerto Rico.
translation.ko: 아니면 푸에르토리코로 가는 편도 티켓을 받거나요

translation.en: [Glenda in Spanish] FEMA is letting us go.
We don't have the resources to be able to move forward
translation.ko: 우린 호텔을 나가면 더는 앞으로 나아갈

translation.en: after we leave the hotel.
[Natasha] It's unfortunate to say that there really has been no improvement in Puerto Rico.
I think if you go there, you may see,
oh, there are some lights back on, there's street lamps up,
translation.ko: 빛이 조금씩 들어오고는 있죠 가로등이 켜졌고

translation.en: some of the roads have been repaired. Those are really superficial.
translation.ko: 몇몇 도로가 보수됐어요 그런 건 정말 새 발의 피죠

translation.en: When you see the closure of hundreds of public schools,
translation.ko: "2018년 6월 허리케인 마리아 상륙 8개월 후" 공립 학교 수백 개가 문을 닫았어요

translation.en: the cuts to the public university system, the closure of health care clinics
translation.ko: 공립 대학 체계가 망가졌고 동네 의원과

translation.en: and parts of hospital wings.
FEMA was offering just a one-way ticket back to something.
translation.ko: 연방재난관리청은 이런 데로 오는 편도 티켓만 제공할 뿐이죠

translation.en: It didn't include a home, didn't include long-term housing.
[woman in Spanish] Hello, Sheila. We invaded the room.
[Glenda] Hello?
[woman in Spanish] Hi. How are you?
[Glenda] Good and how are you?
Good. Honestly, I'm gonna tell you...
translation.ko: 저도 잘 있어요 솔직히 말씀드리면 "전화 연결 지역 사회 활동가"

translation.en: I'll tell you what they are talking about. Please don't get your hopes up.
translation.ko: 정부 쪽 말로는 너무 기대하진 말라고 하네요

translation.en: -This whole thing is upsetting me. -Okay.
To be honest,
a solution by this weekend would be a miracle
because it's so last-minute.
I think the city is trying to pressure people.
translation.ko: 시에서 사람들을 압박하고 있는 거 같아요

translation.en: Pressuring them to go to homeless shelters.
Since a lot of people don't want to go, they'll instead go back to Puerto Rico.
translation.ko: 다들 안 가고 싶어하니까 푸에르토리코로 돌아가려 하겠죠

translation.en: That's the strategy I'm seeing.
Wow.
[boy] So let's go to another hotel.
[Glenda] To another hotel, but it's going to be for people that are homeless.
translation.ko: 다른 호텔로 가도 거기는 집 없는 사람들을 위한 곳이야

translation.en: [woman in Spanish] They have the resources to do something.
translation.ko: 정부는 뭔가 해줄 수 있는 재원이 있어

translation.en: The thing is that they want most of us to leave the country.
translation.ko: 정부는 우리 대부분이 이 나라를 떠나기를 바란다니까

translation.en: We just have to keep living day by day and wait.
-[Glenda] Exactly. -Strong together.
[woman] Right. We can't break down because we went through worse in Puerto Rico.
translation.ko: 맞아, 푸에르토리코에선 더 나쁜 상황도 겪었으니까 무너질 수 없어

translation.en: How long were we without water and electricity in Puerto Rico?
translation.ko: 푸에르토리코에서 물과 전기 없이 얼마나 있었어?

translation.en: -[Nilda] With no food. -Here, we have water and electricity.
translation.ko: - 음식도 없었지 - 여긴 물과 전기는 있잖아

translation.en: Where will we be? We don't know. We just have to wait.
translation.ko: 어디서 지내냐고? 모르지, 기다려 봐야 해

translation.en: -[Kenia] God will provide. -[Nilda] I wish I was you.
Mm-hmm. Exactly.
It's a slow process.
One day at a time.
-[Kenia] How many more days? -Four.
That's right.
[Kenia] We need ice.
Nilda, can you get more ice?
She gets stuck on the phone. I should take it away.
I live alone here. No one listens to me.
translation.ko: 나 여기 혼자 사나 봐 아무도 내 말을 안 듣네

translation.en: Nilda Lee, answer me.
-Oh, Lord. -What?
There you are! [exclaiming]
You're here! Great!
I'm happy you're here!
What time did you get here?
-[chuckling] -I was never gone.
[Glenda] What did you hear? What did the doctor say?
What did he notice about her?
[Kenia] The doctor noticed that what she went through with the hurricane
translation.ko: 의사 말로는 허리케인을 경험한 것이 감정적으로 영향을 미쳤대

translation.en: has affected her emotionally.
translation.ko: 허리케인을 경험한 것이 감정적으로 영향을 미쳤대

translation.en: That those memories aren't going to fade
-until she has stability and security. -[door unlocks, opens]
-Yes. Hi, Nilda Lee. -Uh-huh.
Tell me how it went.
Come here so I can talk to you.
-How did it go? How was it? -[Kenia speaks indistinctly]
translation.ko: 어떻게 됐니? 어땠어?  말해 봐, 어떻게 됐어?

translation.en: [Glenda] You tell me. How did it go?
-Where? -[Glenda] The psychologist's.
-[laughs] -I told him that I was in my house the day of the hurricane.
translation.ko: 허리케인이 오던 날 집에 있었다고 했어요

translation.en: I was young. I thought it was coming to kill me.
translation.ko: 어렸을 때라서 허리케인이 저를 죽이려 온다고 생각했죠

translation.en: I also told him
I've been clenching my fists. I sometimes pull my hair.
translation.ko: 주먹을 꽉 쥔다고 했어요 머리카락을 잡아당길 때도 있고

translation.en: I hide in the bathroom.
Sometimes I drive myself a little crazy.
translation.ko: 어떨 때는 좀 미친 짓을 한다는 얘기도 했죠

translation.en: I have told you that I want to help you
because you're like a daughter to me.
Kenia is like a sister to me.
I want to help you because when I see you
acting like that, pulling your hair, throwing your fists,
or saying you're ugly and that you have no friends--
translation.ko: 못생겼다거나 친구가 없다고 얘기하는 걸 봤으니까

translation.en: Try this instead...
Breathe, calm down, and go on about your day.
translation.ko: 숨 쉬고, 마음을 가라앉힌 다음 네 하루를 얘기하는 거야

translation.en: See yourself as you really are.
You are a very pretty girl who is just starting to live.
translation.ko: 넌 이제 막 삶을 시작하는 아주 예쁜 아이야

translation.en: You have to say, "I am beautiful, and I'm going to conquer the world."
translation.ko: 이렇게 말해야 해, '난 아름답고 세계를 정복할 거야'

translation.en: Keep pushing forward, and you are going to find not just one,
translation.ko: 계속 그렇게 나아가다 보면 한 명이 아니라

translation.en: but millions of friends.
translation.ko: 아주 많은 친구를 사귀게 될 거야

translation.en: [Glenda] We have three days left, and I'm in a bit of a panic.
I don't know if we'll get the assistance
translation.ko: 지원을 받아서 살 곳을 얻게 될지

translation.en: we need to get a roof over our heads, or if we'll be out on the street.
The one thing I know is that we'll be separated.
We won't be together anymore.
[Nilda squeals] No! Come here!
No!
[all] Happy Birthday!
It's from all of us! She's going to cry.
translation.ko: 우리 모두의 선물이란다! 얘가 울려고 하네

translation.en: Come on, Nilda Lee!
This was not our idea.
We had a different idea.
[reporter 1] Hurricane housing for the victims of Hurricane Maria is over.
translation.ko: 허리케인 마리아 이재민을 위한 주택 지원이 끝납니다

translation.en: As of today, most affected families will lose their hotel and motel vouchers
translation.ko: 오늘부터 대다수 가정은 호텔과 모텔 바우처를 못 쓰게 되고

translation.en: and have to find another place to live.
Do you want to take these to storage?
Nilda?
-How many bags do you need? -[Kenia] About four.
Four bags. The big ones.
[woman] Discard everything.
I want to give these to you
because I have to move.
-[woman] I'll take them. -You will?
Calm down. This is a process. It's hard, but...
we'll see each other soon.
[woman in English] What's her name?
-[in Spanish] My name is Sheila Moreno. -Sheila.
translation.ko: - 내 이름은 실라 모레노예요 - 실라 씨

translation.en: -[Shelia] My husband. -[woman] Alvarez. It's him?
[Sheila] Alvarez, my husband. He's right there.
Come here.
[woman 1 in English] Ask them what day did they arrive in New York City.
translation.ko: 좋아요, 뉴욕시에 온 게 언제였는지 물어볼게요

translation.en: [woman 2 in Spanish] When did you arrive to the U.S.?
-[Sheila in Spanish] December 24. -[woman 2 in English] December 24.
[Sheila] We came to the intake office, and they told us that FEMA would help us.
translation.ko: 입국 사무실에 갔더니 연방재난관리청이 도와줄 거랬어요

translation.en: [woman 2 in Spanish] Did FEMA cover your moving expenses?
[Sheila] No, FEMA didn't cover our costs to move here.
Those people aren't helping at all, Kenia.
translation.ko: 그 사람들은 전혀 안 도와줬지, 케니아

translation.en: [Sheila] No, FEMA didn't cover any travel fare money...
translation.ko: 아뇨, 연방재난관리청은 여행 비용도 주지 않았어요

translation.en: They aren't doing anything. They don't help with anything.
translation.ko: 아무것도 안 하고 있어 아무것도 도와주는 게 없다고

translation.en: [woman 1 in English] Do they understand why they're being transferred?
translation.ko: 다른 곳으로 가야 하는 이유를 아는지 물어보세요

translation.en: [woman 2] She says no.
[woman 1] Okay. So tell her the reason why she's being moved
translation.ko: 좋아요, 그럼 왜 이사가야 하는지 이유를 얘기해 줘요

translation.en: is because the government is not paying for her family to stay here anymore.
translation.ko: 정부에서 여기서 머물 수 있는 돈을 내지 않기 때문이라고요

translation.en: For none of the families.
So tell her that she's going to go stay at a shelter.
We don't know how long she's going to be there.
[Kenia] What are they thinking? Are they going to just leave people out on the streets?
translation.ko: 어쩔 생각이죠? 이 사람들을 그냥 거리에 내버려둘 건가요?

translation.en: [woman in English] Excuse me. Excuse me. Excuse me.
[Kenia] These people don't have a place to stay.
[woman 3] Glenda Martez?
[woman 3 in Spanish] Do you have any family you could stay with for a while?
translation.ko: 잠시 동안 함께 지낼 가족이 있나요?

translation.en: Try to think of where you can go.
[Glenda] My son lives in Orlando in a small room with my mom and dad.
translation.ko: 제 아들이 올랜도의 작은 방에서 제 어머니, 아버지와 함께 살아요

translation.en: [crying] I can't go there.
What about my husband's job? Are they giving him a job in Orlando?
translation.ko: 제 남편 일자리는요? 올랜도에 가면 일자리를 준대요?

translation.en: [Sheila] They haven't explained anything to her.
Where are you going?
She said, "You have family in Orlando?" "My son is there."
translation.ko: '올랜도에 가족이 있죠?'라고 묻더라, 내 아들이 거기 있거든

translation.en: "Then go to Orlando." I can't.
Christian lives in a studio. He took in my mom and dad who are sick.
translation.ko: 크리스티안은 원룸에 사는데 아프신 내 부모님을 모셔

translation.en: [Sheila] Try to talk to them when they finish with Kenia.
translation.ko: 저 사람들이 케니아와 얘기 끝내면 말해 볼게

translation.en: They'll explain everything to you,
translation.ko: 저 사람들이 다 설명해 줄 거야 근데...

translation.en: but I have to leave now. Yes, I'll go.
translation.ko: 내가 지금 가봐야 돼... 네, 갈게요

translation.en: I need to go because otherwise...
-It's okay-- -Remember that this is only today.
translation.ko: 이런 건 오늘뿐이라는 걸 잊지 마

translation.en: Because she is saying that she will find you some help.
translation.ko: 저 사람이 도울 수 있는 방법을 찾아 본다고 했으니까

translation.en: Don't cry because that's what they want. To destabilize us so that we take off.
translation.ko: 울지 마, 저들이 원하는 게 이거야 불안하게 해서 떠나게 만드는 거

translation.en: -And that's not the case, okay? -Okay.
Eh... [murmurs softly]
-This is what's left. -Yes, I know.
[brother] Nothing but dust.
First Hurricane Maria...
and then this ordeal.
[Kenia] I miss him, like I miss Mom.
I miss him looking after me and my daughter.
translation.ko: 저와 제 딸을 돌봐주셨던 게 그립죠

translation.en: I feel so lonely.
[Kenia] It's not that they just died. They let them die.
translation.ko: 사람들은 '그냥 죽은' 게 아니에요 죽게 방치됐던 거죠

translation.en: And hurricane season is coming again.
